column1: Update to currently supported ruby versions
Use a CTE to prevent a nested loop from locking multiple jobs
scheduled_at should come back as a Time object
Remove support for older Postgres versions, also add migrations for 4.0.0
Don't rescue Time.now exceptions in log_yield
Add some fixes for fresh installs with AR migrations
Make QC fail with versions of PG < 9.6, add notes in readme and changâ€¦
Add frozen string literal to everything
Add testing for other versions of ruby and pg
check that the connection is still able to make queries
Change ruby versions to currently supported ones.
Automatically retry enqueuing after connection reset
CI against current newest stable rubies (take 2)
Update setup to reflect latest stable release
Change all SQL keywords to uppercase
Use correct gem version specification in README
show how to run a single test in the readme
Add handler when job is a success so it's easier to add custom logging / monitoring
more detailed example in the README
Don't rescue Time.now exceptions in log_yield
Rescue ScriptError and NoMemoryError as well as StandardError.
Give some <3 to our unit tests
Change QC::Queue interface to support setting the conn adapter in the constructor.
Make QC a bit thread safe
Add exception location to default `handle_failure` output
Handle edge case of a job mutating arguments
make it possible to inject a custom worker for QC's rake tasks.
detect Rails DB connection and use it
Fix Worker for use with DATABASE_URL
Change spec so it doesn't freak out on multiple pg connections
Fixes forking for workers. Should not corrupt pg connection anymore.
Support for scheduling jobs in the future
handle_failure method gets access to queue from which the failing job originated
Relax job selection if job_count < top_boundary
Account for locked_at in job_count query
Account for locked_at in job_count query
Updated QC::Queue.new usage in README to new usage
Workers than can work multiple queues.
Documentation fix: reenqueueing failed jobs is described correctly
Use correct environment variable for CONCURRENCY option in README
Don't lock jobs indefinitely when worker crashed (#165)
Improve README example: make TERM trap functional
use json from the stdlib as MultiJson will be discontinued
fix `QC::Conn#connect` when url has no host.
Bugfix: misspelling of word functions in tasks
Change how log_yield calculates time elapsed to match log
Use explict rubygems url in Gemfile
bump a few out of date version numbers
On new job, issue NOTIFY via trigger.
Use json type for the args column if json is available.
The connection count test should restrict the test to current database.
ruby-debug19 does not work with ruby-2.0.0-p0
Change `lock_head` to log and sleep before retrying
Allows more complex constructs for jobs.
extract #perform from #work to run a job
Fix error in usage example of QC::Queue.new
don't try to fetch more jobs after having been signaled
Allow percent-encoded socket paths in ENV[{QC_,}DATABASE_URL]
Adding callbacks before and after call method
proof of concept: Rails 4 Queue API
Use MultiJson to improve JSON performance when possible
Show prototype for log and log_yield in readme
Add note on using schema_format = :sql with Rails.
Fallback to ActiveRecord connection if no ENV variables exist
Default whether to notify based on QC::LISTENING_WORKER
Added env option to write the current PID to a file.
QC doesn't repair connection when database temporary goes offline
db_url  get DATABASE_URL before QC_DATABASE_URL should be better
fix delete all when passing queue name
Remove '\' from readme where not needed.
fix drop_ddl and add load and unload queries
Minor updates to ease installation process
Removed old default queue name reference (table name)
I had to make this change to get the migration to run.
fix typo in rake task name
Revert "Newline Serialization" escaping and vendor in OkJson
Add Queue test for defaut table name
Use parameterised queries to prevent SQL escaping issues.
Add `transaction` helper method for batch queueing.
Setting DATABASE_URL in initializer not working as expected
Sql functions: assist with CREATE and DROP.
Rake tasks: corrected, described, and DRYed up
A few cleanups that looked like they needed to be done.
only one connection per worker (instead of 2) & default test database
README + toolchain update for new developers
